messages.subject: Santa Fe Home Study Program
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks to everyone who responded by e-mail on through the loop to help me with record-keeping and curriculum description.  I think what I m most lacking in at
messages.messageBody:
Thanks to everyone who responded by e-mail on through the loop to help me
with record-keeping and curriculum description. I think what I'm most
lacking in at this point is confidence and experience. I also have a fear
of how my efforts will be discredited by DH and the court system if DH
questions our unschooling.

I've recently learned about the Santa Fe Home Study Program, and am
wondering if any of you are familiar with them or have ever used them. It
may be just the ticket for me. They will collect my log entries and
translate them into class credits quarterly based upon hours. They will
also provide support in helping to translate the day's activities into the
logbook entries. I figure I could probably benefit by doing this with them
for a year. Then I'd probably have enough confidence and experience to go
it on my own, although I may benefit legally from a sustained relationship
with them. Any input appreciated, Thanks, Annette
